What is Haikang Vision (Hikvision)?

Haikang Vision, commonly known as Hikvision (full name: Hangzhou Hikvision Digital Technology Co., Ltd.), is a leading Chinese multinational corporation specializing in video surveillance equipment, security systems, and AIoT (AI + Internet of Things) solutions. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Hangzhou, it’s partly state-owned and one of the world’s largest suppliers of CCTV cameras, network video recorders, and related technologies for both civilian and government applications. The company focuses on intelligent monitoring, data analytics, and automation to enhance security and operational efficiency across industries.

Does Meiyijia Convenience Store Use Hikvision Products?

Yes, Meiyijia (美宜佳), China’s largest convenience store chain with over 33,000 stores primarily in Guangdong and expanding nationwide, uses Hikvision products for its surveillance and monitoring systems. Tutorials and user guides for accessing Meiyijia’s store CCTV feeds explicitly reference Hikvision software tools, such as downloading the “Device Network Search Tool” from the Hikvision website to view recordings and live feeds on computers. This indicates integration of Hikvision hardware like cameras and recorders in their store operations for security and remote monitoring.
